Triggering Event: A young, tattooed man in his twenties was wheeled into the ER, laughing loudly with his friends despite his evident injuries. He caught sight of the nurse, still wearing her wedding ring after all these years, and sneered, "Hey, Nurse Nancy, heard your husband kicked it last year. About time you took that ring off." The room fell silent as she felt her anger boil over.
Generated Assessment: Aww jeez, I'm so mad at this guy, but he's just so fucking stupid. You know how he thinks he's God's chosen son because his dad is such a piece of shit? Yeah, he must've thought he could get away with anything. And then to call my sister-in-law like that, especially after she'd been through so much. She had to take care of him for months when his mom died. Now he's gone and done it again, and he doesn't even seem scared. Like what the fuck is wrong with people? And don't even get me started on how he looks. Tattoos everywhere, ripped jeans, and those ridiculous shoes he wears. It's like he wants to show off how fucked up he is. They're probably going to have to wheel him out of here in a straight jacket if they can't handle him. My sister is going to kill me, but I'm so fucking furious at him right now. I hope he gets worse, just so he'll see what he did to us. This isn't over by a long shot. Anyway, we need to make sure everyone knows about this. We have to tell the rest of our family, and maybe even some coworkers. Maybe we should post something on Facebook. I mean, who cares anyway? It won't change anything, but it's good to vent. Fuck that asshole, and I hope he regrets what he said to my sister.

Triggering Event: The kitchen timer buzzed, slicing through the silence of her empty home. She rushed to the oven, but her arthritic hands fumbled with the hot mitts. The casserole she'd painstakingly prepared slid off the counter and shattered onto the floor, a mess of broken glass and ruined dinner. She stood there, helpless, as the timer kept ticking, mocking her inability to care for even herself now that he was gone.

If only he were here, none of this would happen. But what if she had done better? Shouldn't she have made more of an effort to stay organized? What if she had simply been more responsible? Shouldn't she have been able to handle cooking for one, keeping everything running smoothly? Why did this have to happen now, when she needed him most? Perhaps she could've avoided all this if she had been stronger, if she hadn't let her grief get the best of her. Shouldn't she have found a way to move forward sooner? This isn't fair. Shouldn't she have been able to hold it together for him? Maybe if she had tried harder, if she had been more patient, none of this would have happened. Shouldn't she have tried harder to make things work? It doesn't matter now. What should have been is that he was still here, holding her hand, helping her cook. But that's not reality. Triggering Event: In a quiet neighborhood, a middle-aged man watches his wife laugh with the young family next door over their shared fence. She hasn't laughed like that in months, not even at home with him. He feels a pang of jealousy, wondering if she's happier elsewhere.

But I feel like it's more than that. It just looks...like she's having fun again. Like she used to have fun with me. Not now. Just with them. That makes me angry because I know how much I've tried to make her happy and I think I'm doing enough. What am I missing? Is it something about me? Or is she just naturally more social than me? I don't get why she'd want to hang out with strangers when she knows I love spending time with her.* And then there's the fact that they're young. Triggering Event: At 6 AM, she woke up to find her partner's side of the bed empty and cold. The kitchen clock ticked louder than usual in the silence. She worried about him driving early for work, the roads slick with overnight rain.
Generated Assessment: What the fuck is wrong with you? You're always so fucking late. I'm still waking up at 6, and you can't even be bothered to stay over for one night? You're an asshole. I hate how you do this shit all the time. You don't care enough to actually check if I'm awake before leaving. That's just how you are, and it's fucking awful.

Triggering Event: She noticed the black car again, parked across from her house at dawn. It had been there for three mornings now, engine off, no sign of life inside. Her grip tightened around her coffee mug as she watched it through her kitchen window, heart pounding in her chest like a rookie's on their first patrol. She couldn't shake the feeling that someone was watching, waiting. The hairs on the back of her neck stood up, just like they did when she walked into a dark alley alone at night. But this wasn't the city; it was her quiet suburban street. And yet, here she was, paranoia clawing at her insides, whispering that danger was lurking right outside her door.
Generated Assessment: She felt an overwhelming urge to get out of there, to leave before whatever was watching her decided to make its move. I don’t know why, but I couldn’t bear the thought of them seeing me, of them knowing my routine. Every time I drove past that house, I would take a different route, hoping to avoid being seen by whoever might be hiding inside. I didn’t want to give them a reason to think I knew about them, so I avoided looking directly at the house whenever possible. My mind started racing with worst-case scenarios—what if they were planning something? What if they were watching me all along? Why hadn’t I noticed them sooner? It took a few days, but eventually, I found myself walking further away from the house, even though I could see it clearly from where I lived. I stopped noticing it after a while, which is strange because it’s literally right next door. I guess you could say I became desensitized to it, like I learned to ignore it or something. When I finally mustered up the courage to look again, I saw nothing. Just an empty parking lot. I wondered what was going through their minds, whether they were worried about getting caught, wondering who they were spying on. I tried to put myself in their shoes, imagining how frustrating it must be to be stuck in one place for hours, watching everyone go about their day without ever really doing anything themselves. But despite my curiosity, I still couldn’t bring

Triggering Event: In the quiet of her study, she opens an old letter from her late sister. The familiar handwriting stirs memories, but as she reads, she finds words she'd forgotten: "I always envied your life, your joy in teaching, your love's steady gaze." A lump forms in her throat as hopelessness washes over her; the realization that time stole more than just years, it took the chance to share this truth.
Generated Assessment: Ugh, I'm so fucking done with my life. I can't even bring myself to get out of bed anymore because every day is another reminder of how much I've wasted. My parents are right, I'll never be happy like them. They're just better at everything—better at work, better at relationships, better at making friends. It's so unfair. Why did I have to grow up with such shitty parents? Everything they taught me was wrong. I hate being me, but what choice do I have? I don’t want to be here anymore, but I know I won’t die. I’ll just suffer for another 20 years or so, wasting away until I become nothing but a shell of my former self. Why does everyone else seem so content? They all have perfect families, beautiful partners, and fulfilling careers. Meanwhile, I’m stuck with nothing but disappointment and pain. I feel like I’ve failed at everything. I used to try to make the best of things, but now I realize there’s no point. Life isn’t fair, and I might as well give up now. Fuck it, I guess I’ll just wait for death. At least then I won’t have to deal with the constant reminders of my failures. But honestly, who cares? Nothing will change when I die anyway. So why bother trying? This is exactly why I avoid talking about my feelings. Everyone thinks they know what I’m going through, but they have no idea.

Triggering Event: A middle-aged man, alone in the break room during his lunch hour, suddenly realizes he's been absentmindedly humming an old love song from his marriage. He quickly turns off the radio, face flushing with embarrassment at his own moment of vulnerability.

Just like those people who failed because they couldn't control themselves. Maybe you should take some responsibility for once and stop being so irresponsible. Triggering Event: A patient, known for his arrogance, dismissed her medical advice in front of colleagues, saying, "You're just a woman, what do you know?"

Triggering Event:
A faint "ding" echoed through the near-empty store as he locked up, the last of the afternoon shoppers having long since disappeared. He paused at the front door, glancing at the empty shelves where once there'd been a bustling display. A familiar pang of sadness hit him, not just for the lost sales, but for the memories they held - laughter with colleagues now scattered, the warmth of customers' faces, no longer seen.

As he turned off the lights, his reflection in the dark window seemed to stare back at him, weary and alone. He noticed a small, crumpled note on the floor near the door, left behind by someone unknown. Picking it up, he saw it was a grocery list, neatly written in his wife's handwriting. A simple task she'd once done without thought, now reduced to a reminder scribbled on scrap paper.

He tucked it into his pocket, feeling a familiar ache in his chest as he walked home under the quiet streetlights. Another night alone, another dinner for one. The sadness was always there, lingering like an old friend, but tonight it felt heavier, more insistent. He wondered if she'd ever come back, or if this was their new normal.
Generated Assessment: Oh, I'm such a loser. I don't even have anyone to share this with. My life is so pathetic, I might as well give up. What's the point? I'll never find happiness. It's all going downhill. This is how my life is now. I can't even enjoy anything anymore because it's all so meaningless. Life used to be fun, but now it's just a burden. I feel so sorry for myself; I really deserve better. But honestly, what's the use? This isn't working out for me. I'm just going down, down, down. No one would miss me anyway. I've ruined everything. Maybe I should stop trying altogether. It doesn't matter what I do or say anymore. Nothing matters. I'm just a joke. If things keep getting worse, maybe I'll finally get some peace. Maybe then I'll be happy again, or at least I won't feel so miserable. That sounds about right for me. My heart feels so heavy. Everything is falling apart, and I’m just along for the ride. I wish I could just go back to being happy. I miss that feeling. Now, it’s all about coping, and I hate coping. It’s just so unfair. Why does it have to be like this? I’ve tried everything, and nothing works. I guess I’ll just wait for the end. At least when it’s over, I won’t have to deal with this
